Comment: Huh?  The way you wrote that, you’re saying A5 would apply to a non-NATO country.  I don’t see that.  Short answer to the question is A5 would not apply.  It is a defensive treaty for a NATO country.  If a NATO country attacks ANOTHER NATO country, then A5 kicks in.  But that really wasn’t the question.  The question was if a NATO attacks another country not in NATO, does A5 kick in on the COUNTER attack.  I have not seen a definitive answer to that, but I would think it’s a “yes” based on the wording.  Edit: did a little more research and the answer is no.  A5 is PURELY a defensive measure and would not support an act of offensive aggression by ANY country - including NATO countries.
